c74object.name: growbuffer~
c74object.digest: Reference and potentially grow an external buffer
c74object.description: The `growbuffer~` object allows referencing an external buffer~ by name and performing operations on it. It also supports `polybuffer~` objects by automatically iterating through all numbered members (e.g., `name.1`, `name.2`, etc.) if a single buffer with the given name is not found.

inlet.digest: (bang) report length, (number) resize, (set) set buffer name
inlet.description: Sending a bang will post the length of the referenced buffer in milliseconds to the Max console. Sending a number (int or float) will resize the referenced buffer to that many milliseconds, preserving existing content. Sending the message set followed by a symbol will change the referenced buffer. If a `polybuffer~` is detected (via indexed names like `name.1`), operations are applied to all members.
Sending a symbol to the second inlet will change the referenced buffer.

objarg.name: buffer-name
objarg.digest: Name of the buffer~ to reference
objarg.description: The first argument specifies the name of an external buffer~ object to reference.

method.name: bang
method.description: Posts the length of the currently referenced buffer in milliseconds to the Max console.

method.name: int
method.description: Resizes the referenced buffer to the specified number of milliseconds. Existing audio data is preserved.

method.name: float
method.description: Resizes the referenced buffer to the specified number of milliseconds. Existing audio data is preserved.

method.name: set
method.description: Changes the referenced buffer~ object to the one specified by the symbol argument.
